title: Halal Guys Chicken and Rice
description: A delicious street food dish from NYC.
ingredients: White sauce (mayonnaise, yogurt, lemon juice, vinegar, garlic, sugar, salt)
cookingInstructions: Cut the chicken beforehand to cook it more evenly and avoid staining the cutting board.

In a bowl, add the olive oil, lemon juice, vinegar, minced garlic, cumin, turmeric, paprika, and salt and pepper to create a chicken marinade. Let the chicken marinate for at least 2 hours, preferably overnight.
Heat a grill or skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook for about 5-7 minutes on each side, until fully cooked and slightly charred.

For the rice, melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add rice, cumin, and turmeric, stirring for a minute. Add chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 18-20 minutes. Fluff with a fork and mix in the parsley.
Serve the chicken sliced over the rice. Drizzle with white sauce and hot sauce to taste.

title: Guacamole
description: A classic Mexican avocado dip, perfect as a snack or appetizer.
cookingInstructions: Halve the avocados and remove the pits, then scoop the flesh into a medium mixing bowl.
Use a fork to mash the avocado to your desired consistency.
Squeeze the lime juice directly over the mashed avocado to prevent browning.
Add salt and stir to combine.
Fold in the diced onions, minced cilantro, diced tomatoes, and minced garlic. Mix well to evenly distribute the ingredients.
Season with a pinch of ground cayenne pepper for a spicy kick, if desired.
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap directly on the surface of the guacamole to prevent air reaching it and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.

title: Pasta with Pesto
description: A simple yet flavorful Italian dish, featuring pasta coated in a rich basil pesto sauce.
cookingInstructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and add the pasta, cooking according to the package's instructions until al dente.
In the meantime, combine the fresh basil leaves, grated Parmesan cheese, pine nuts, and minced garlic in a food processor.
Pulse the ingredients while gradually adding the extra virgin olive oil until the mixture becomes smooth and creamy.
Season the pesto sauce with salt and pepper to taste.
Drain the pasta, reserving a little of the cooking water.
Mix the pesto sauce with the pasta in a large bowl, adding a few tablespoons of the reserved pasta water to achieve a creamy consistency.
Serve the pasta immediately, garnished with additional grated Parmesan cheese if desired.

title: Nigerian Meat Pies
description: Savory pastry snacks filled with seasoned minced meat.
cookingInstructions: To make the pastry, mix flour and a pinch of salt, then cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Gradually add water, stirring until dough forms. Wrap and chill.
Heat oil in a pan, cook onions until soft. Add minced meat, cook until browned. Add carrots, potatoes, peas, crumbled bouillon cube, thyme, salt, and pepper. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Preheat oven to 350째F (175째C). Roll out dough, cut circles, place filling on one half, then fold over and seal edges. Brush with beaten egg.
Bake for 30-35 minutes or until golden brown.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: 2 cups semisweet and/or milk chocolate chips
cookingInstructions: Preheat oven to 350째F (175째C).
In a small bowl, whisk together flour and baking soda; set aside.

In a large bowl, combine butter with both sugars; beat on medium speed until light and fluffy. Reduce speed to low; add salt, vanilla, and eggs. Beat until well mixed, about 1 minute. Add flour mixture; mix until just combined. Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop heaping tablespoon-size balls of dough about 2 inches apart on baking sheets lined with parchment paper.

Bake until cookies are golden around the edges, but still soft in the center, 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from oven, and let cool on baking sheet 1 to 2 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack, and let cool completely.

title: Creole Jambalaya
description: A soulful and savory dish deeply rooted in Louisiana's culinary culture.
cookingInstructions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add chicken and sausage; cook until browned. Remove with a slotted spoon and set aside.
In the same pot, add onion, bell pepper, celery, and garlic. Cook until vegetables are softened, about 5 minutes.
Stir in diced tomatoes, chicken broth, rice, paprika, cayenne, thyme, oregano, salt, and pepper. Bring to a simmer.
Return chicken and sausage to the pot. Cover and simmer until rice is cooked, about 20 minutes.
Stir in shrimp and cook until pink, about 5 minutes. Garnish with green onions before serving.

title: Soup Dumplings
description: Soup dumplings are a celebrated Chinese delicacy that encapsulate a rich, savory broth and a tender meat filling, typically pork, inside a thin, delicate dough wrapper.
cookingInstructions: Mix flour with warm water to form a dough. Knead until smooth, then cover and let rest.
Mix ground pork, jellied chicken stock, soy sauce, sesame oil, ginger, green onions, and salt.
Roll out dough and cut into small circles. Place a small amount of filling in the center of each circle. Gather the edges and seal the dumpling.
Steam dumplings in a bamboo steamer over boiling water for about 10 minutes or until cooked through.

title: Pho
ingredients: Toppings: basil, lime wedges, bean sprouts, sliced green onions, and sliced jalapenos
cookingInstructions: Char onions and ginger under the broiler or over an open flame. Add to a large pot along with star anise, cloves, cinnamon, cardamom, coriander seeds, beef bone, and brisket. Cover with water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for at least 2 hours.
Remove brisket and set aside. Strain broth and return to pot; season with fish sauce.
Cook rice noodles according to package instructions. Slice brisket.
Assemble bowls with noodles, broth, slices of brisket and sirloin. The heat of the broth will cook the thin sirloin slices. Serve with toppings.
